results.title: Jezebel
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On the eve of the Civil War, Julie Marston, a wilful southern belle, does everything in her spiteful power to goad her fiance into a jealous rage. When he is stricken by the plague, she reforms and tries to atone her wicked and sinful ways. Starring Henry Fonda and Bette Davis in her second Best Actress Academy Award performance. Based on the play by Owen Davis Sr.

results.title: The Prince and the pauper (1937)
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. For amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Circumstances, however, conspire to turn their childish prank into a dangerous game. Stars Errol Flynn and Claude Rains. Based on the novel by Mark Twain.

results.title: To Be or Not to Be
results.creator_credit: Ernst Lubitsch, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A Warsaw theatre group, before and during the Nazi invasion, wages war on Hitler on a devious new battleground - the Shakespearean stage. The actors improvise an underground plot and an impersonation of invading Nazis, including Adolf Hitler. Stars Jack Benny, Robert Stack and Carole Lombard in her final performance.

results.title: 49th Parallel
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell and General Film Distributions, Ortus
results.brief_description: After the sinking of Nazi U-boat 37 by the Royal Canadian Air Force during World War II, six Nazi survivors of the attack reach an Eskimo village and commit every sort of crime in their effort to reach the neutral territory of the U.S. This is an important and effective example of propaganda films. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Leslie Howard, Raymond Massey and Glynis Johns.

results.title: She wore a yellow ribbon
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered one of John Ford’s finest Westerns, “She wore a yellow ribbon” is the epic tale of cavalry life on the harsh American frontier. John Wayne is Captain Brittles, about to retire from the cavalry, but called back by his troops to defend them from the Apache Indians who have declared Holy War on the white man. Only Brittles has enough knowledge of Apache life to devise a strategy which will prevent a bloody massacre. The stunning locations are in Monument Valley and the cinematography won an Academy Award for Winton C. Hoch. Also starring John Agar, Joanne Dru, Victor McLaglen and Ben Johnson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures

results.title: Jungle book
results.creator_credit: Zoltan Korda, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy returns to his native village attempting to adapt to human customs and his adopted family. The discovery of a coin in the jungle awakens the greed of the village people who hope to discover a legendary buried treasure. Disillusioned by the greed and violence of humanity he retreats to his loyal and trusted friends…the beasts of the jungle. Stars Sabu. Based on “Jungle book” by Rudyard Kipling.

results.title: Bringing Up Baby
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is an absent-minded zoology professor who needs one million dollars for his nature museum. Katharine Hepburn, in her first foray into real comedy, is an heiress who is determined to get him the money, and to win his heart. However, first she must get him to drop his fiance, find his dinosaur bone which she has lost, and convince him to look after her pet leopard named Baby. An outstanding, fast-paced comedy and one of Howard Hawk’s most loved films.

results.title: Matewan
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Peggy Rajski, Goldcrest and Red Dog Films
results.brief_description: A realistic account of the fierce struggle that raged in the coalfields of West Virginia in the 1920’s between coalminers, fighting for trade-union rights, and mine-owners who employed gangster methods to maintain crippling conditions and pay. Features photography by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: The Good Earth
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Irving G. Thalberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in pre-revolutionary China, Paul Muni plays Wang Lung, a simple peasant farmer who rises to become a prosperous lord. Tragedy pursues him as he betrays his family and neglects the earth he has worshipped. Luise Rainer won an Academy Award for her portrayal of O-Lan, Wang’s devoted wife, a battered slave who grows into a proud, loyal woman. Based on Pearl S. Buck’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel.

constellations_other.name: Legacy of an icon: Anna May Wong
constellations_other.description: Wong Liu Tsong, known professionally as Anna May Wong, was a film star in the 1920s and 30s who made a career for herself despite racist stereotypes and vilification. Her legacy lives on as she is now being portrayed by contemporary actors on film and TV.

results.title: Gaslight
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Arthur Hornblow and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Paula, a susceptible and romantic minded young woman who marries Gregory Anton (Charles Boyer), whose suave manner conceals his murderous intentions and an obsession with finding precious jewels hidden in her London home. She becomes his helpless victim as he slowly drives her to the brink of insanity.
